data.title: Blackjack calculator
data.statement:
Create a program that receives the cards drawn by a player and by the dealer and output who won.

To calculate the final score, your program needs to follow these rules:
- Numbers ({{2}}-{{10}}) are worth their own value
- {{K}}, {{Q}}, and {{J}} are worth {{10}}
- {{A}} is worth {{11}} unless it would cause the hand's total to exceed {{21}}, in which case it is worth {{1}}
- Sum the card values to get the hand's final score

To get the results:
- If the player's final score exceeds {{21}}, the dealer wins instantly
- If the dealer's final score exceeds {{21}}, the player wins instantly
- If both final scores are {{21}} or less, whoever has the most points wins
- In case of ties, the dealer wins

Your program needs to output the winner ({{you}} or {{dealer}}) and the winner's score.

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn:
4
A A A A
3
J Q K

data.constraints:
2 ≤ [[p]] ≤ 5
2 ≤ [[c]] ≤ 5
There are no cases where both the player's and the dealer's final scores exceed 21
data.stubGenerator:
read p:int
loopline p point:word(2)

read c:int
loopline c point:word(2)

write winner score
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[p]] for the number of player's cards.
<<Line 2:>> A string containing [[p]] cards.
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[c]] for the number of dealer's cards.
<<Line 4:>> A string containing [[c]] cards.
data.outputDescription: The [[winner]] ({{you}} or {{dealer}}) and the winner's score separated by a space.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Create a program that receives the cards drawn by a player and by the dealer and output who won.

To calculate the final score, your program needs to follow these rules:
- Numbers (2-10) are worth their own value
- K, Q, and J are worth 10
- A is worth 11 unless it would cause the hand's total to exceed 21, in which case it is worth 1
- Sum the card values to get the hand's final score

To get the results:
- If the player's final score exceeds 21, the dealer wins instantly
- If the dealer's final score exceeds 21, the player wins instantly
- If both final scores are 21 or less, whoever has the most points wins
- In case of ties, the dealer wins

Your program needs to output the winner (you or dealer) and the winner's score.
Input
Line 1: An integer p for the number of player's cards.
Line 2: A string containing p cards.
Line 3: An integer c for the number of dealer's cards.
Line 4: A string containing c cards.
Output
The winner (you or dealer) and the winner's score separated by a space.
Constraints
2 ≤ p ≤ 5
2 ≤ c ≤ 5
There are no cases where both the player's and the dealer's final scores exceed 21
Example
Input
3
9 5 4
3
2 6 9
Output
you 18
